body:
Between all the tumultuous celebrations on Twitter another subtext became clear. The tweeps who helped organize the downfall of Mubarak are now looking to their immediate future. I gather here a few pertinent posts that should be posted for posterity...

Some wondered at the new world created by the revolution:

 mohamedhicham7 (@mohamedhicham7)
11/02/2011 19:37 
RT  @Dima_Khatib: I dream of traveling one day in the liberated Arab World  without a single visa, without even a passport .. I have a dream #jan25  #sidibouzid
 Democracy Now! (@democracynow)
11/02/2011 17:24 
Blogger @alaa: “Everything is different. This is a new #Egypt. This is a new me, a new us.” STREAM: http://ow.ly/3UMxg #jan25

 ريان Ryan الريان (@Messrologist)
11/02/2011 
This Revolution Will have a Greater Influence than The French Revolution. Not only Will it Change a Nation, but Will Change a concept #jan25

Some looked to relieve others that suffered from Mubarak's policies:

 1inah (@1inah)
11/02/2011 19:29 
RT  @Jnoubiyeh: #Mubarak helped Israel illegally besiege the Palestinians  of #Gaza. Now that he has been ousted, the brutal siege must go too.  #Jan25 #Egypt

 AmoonaE ~ امونه بترد عليكم ~
OPEN RAFAH GATE! OPEN #GAZA! Liberate 1.5 million of people; they are calling for you! #Feb11 #Egypt #Jan25

 angelsavant ~AS~
RT @smolny1917: The revolution in #Egypt must defend the Palestinian people by dismantling the Israeli-Egyptian blockade of Gaza. #jan25

 ريان Ryan الريان (@Messrologist)
11/02/2011 19:46 
Please  RT This a Million Times : "Lift The siege of Gaza" ... "Lift The siege  of Gaza"..."Lift The siege of Gaza" ... Jan25 #Gaza #Palestine

Others look to erase Mubarak's presence from their country in their own way...

 candacedatz (@candacedatz) 
11/02/2011 19:37 
RT @monasosh: We just scratched out "Mubarak" name from metro-stations map & replaced it wt " the martyrs" #Jan25 http://yfrog.com/gy4vuuj 

and even more look to the next revolution...

 ahmedelmasri (@ahmedelmasri)11/02/2011 19:32 
RT @hibaalali: Let us support Iraq's "Day of Rage" Feb. 25, 2011 so Iraqis regain their freedom & dignity http://bit.ly/fm24bl #Iraq #Feb25 #Egypt #Jan25

 antoniolarotta (@antoniolarotta)
11/02/2011 19:37 
if we get a million people on the streets of London #March26 can we call for an end to #Cameron? #Egypt #Jan25"

To all the dictators out there - sweet dreams...

Between all the tumultuous celebrations on Twitter another subtext became clear. The tweeps who helped organize the downfall of Mubarak are now looking to their immediate future. I gather here a few pertinent posts that should be posted for posterity... Some wondered at the new world created by the revolution:
mohamedhicham7 (@mohamedhicham7) 11/02/2011 19:37
RT @Dima_Khatib: I dream of traveling one day in the liberated Arab World without a single visa, without even a passport .. I have a dream #jan25 #sidibouzid
Democracy Now! (@democracynow) 11/02/2011 17:24
Blogger @alaa: “Everything is different. This is a new #Egypt. This is a new me, a new us.” STREAM: http://ow.ly/3UMxg #jan25
ريان Ryan الريان (@Messrologist) 11/02/2011
This Revolution Will have a Greater Influence than The French Revolution. Not only Will it Change a Nation, but Will Change a concept #jan25
Some looked to relieve others that suffered from Mubarak's policies:
1inah (@1inah) 11/02/2011 19:29
RT @Jnoubiyeh: #Mubarak helped Israel illegally besiege the Palestinians of #Gaza. Now that he has been ousted, the brutal siege must go too. #Jan25 #Egypt
AmoonaE ~ امونه بترد عليكم ~ OPEN RAFAH GATE! OPEN #GAZA! Liberate 1.5 million of people; they are calling for you! #Feb11 #Egypt #Jan25
angelsavant ~AS~ RT @smolny1917: The revolution in #Egypt must defend the Palestinian people by dismantling the Israeli-Egyptian blockade of Gaza. #jan25
ريان Ryan الريان (@Messrologist) 11/02/2011 19:46
Please RT This a Million Times : "Lift The siege of Gaza" ... "Lift The siege of Gaza"..."Lift The siege of Gaza" ... Jan25 #Gaza #Palestine
Others look to erase Mubarak's presence from their country in their own way...
candacedatz (@candacedatz)
11/02/2011 19:37
RT @monasosh: We just scratched out "Mubarak" name from metro-stations map & replaced it wt " the martyrs" #Jan25 http://yfrog.com/gy4vuuj
and even more look to the next revolution...
ahmedelmasri (@ahmedelmasri)11/02/2011 19:32
RT @hibaalali: Let us support Iraq's "Day of Rage" Feb. 25, 2011 so Iraqis regain their freedom & dignity http://bit.ly/fm24bl #Iraq #Feb25 #Egypt #Jan25
antoniolarotta (@antoniolarotta) 11/02/2011 19:37
if we get a million people on the streets of London #March26 can we call for an end to #Cameron? #Egypt #Jan25"
To all the dictators out there - sweet dreams...
title: Egypt: Revolutions to the future
